en: InnerSource Obstacles Survey
中文: 内源障碍调查

en: * Initially, we are starting a number of pilot projects to fine-tune the InnerSource process. To inform you better about how you can be a part of this exciting and important initiative, we first ask you to identify your role:
中文: 我们将启动许多试点项目来对我们的内源流程进行磨合。 为了让您更好地了解自己如何参与这项激动人心的重要计划，我们首先请您确定您的角色：

en: Part of management
中文: 管理成员

en: Owner/Maintainer of one of the pilot projects/ potential pilot projects
中文: 正在试点的项目或者潜在的试点项目的责任人或者管理人员

en: Developer, not in any of the above roles
中文: 开发者，不属于上面的角色

en: We would like to know more about any concerns you might have so that we can address and account for them. A few common concerns are listed below. For the following questions, please rate how well a particular option fits with your concerns about InnerSource adoption from your personal perspective on a scale of 0 to 10, where 0: 'Not at all fits', 10: 'perfectly fits'
中文: 我们想进一步了解您可能遇到的任何问题，以便我们解决并统计这些问题。 下面列出了一些常见的问题。 对于以下问题，请从您个人的角度以0到10的等级来评估特定选项与你对内源推行的顾虑的符合程度，其中0：“一点都不符合”，10： “完全符合”

en: Thank You! Your response has been recorded.
中文: 谢谢！您所提交的信息已保存。

en: I do not know what InnerSource is
中文: 我不知道内源是什么

en: I am not sure about the “benefits” of InnerSource
中文: 我不确定内源能带来什么样的好处

en: I do not know what InnerSource is/ I am not sure about the “benefits” of InnerSource
中文: 我不知道内源是什么/我不确定内源能带来什么样的好处

en: Don't know what InnerSource is/Not sure about the benefits of InnerSource
中文: 我不知道内源是什么/我不确定内源能带来什么样的好处

en: Not sure about the benefits of InnerSource
中文: 我不确定内源能带来什么样的好处

en: We don’t have enough resources to let the developers contribute to projects from other teams
中文: 我们没有足够的资源来让开发人员为其他团队的项目做出贡献

en: Lack of resource to allow cross-contribution
中文: 我们没有足够的资源来让开发人员为其他团队的项目做出贡献

en: Contributions from other teams won’t be of sufficient quality
中文: 来自其它团队的贡献质量不高

en: Unsure about Quality of outsider contributions
中文: 不确信外部贡献者的代码质量水平。

en: Not knowing the person(s) responsible for a bug might slow responses to customers
中文: 不认识负责处理Bug的人员可能会减慢对客户的响应

en: Customer Service Impact from not knowing buggy code creator
中文: 不认识负责处理Bug的人员可能会减慢对客户的响应

en: Potential change in the management structure would disrupt the established workflow
中文: 潜在管理结构的变化将破坏已建立的工作流程

en: Potential change in Management structure disrupting workflow
中文: 潜在管理结构的变化将破坏已建立的工作流程

en: There might not be a budget allocated for InnerSource
中文: 可能没有为内源分配预算

en: Budget Allocation for InnerSource
中文: 内源的预算分配

en: Contributions by others would not be of sufficient quality
中文: 他人的贡献质量不高

en: People would create issues, but won’t submit any patches, and I’ll have to maintain it
中文: 大家会提交问题，但不会提交任何补丁，而我必须维护它

en: Lack of Patchers
中文: 大家会提交问题，但不会提交任何补丁

en: I’m unsure about the responsibilities
中文: 我不确定内源的责任

en: Unsure about the Responsibilities
中文: 我不确定内源的责任

en: I won’t have enough time for mentoring other contributors
中文: 我没有足够的时间来指导其他贡献者

en: Lack of time for Mentoring
中文: 我没有足够的时间来指导其他贡献者

en: If I publish code as InnerSource, others will take the code and the credit
中文: 如果我以内源方式发布代码，则其他人将会窃取这些代码并且占有我的工作

en: Code 'Stolen' without proper credit
中文: 如果我以内源方式发布代码，则其他人将会窃取这些代码并且占有我的工作

en: I would not be happy to publish my code as InnerSource for others to review
中文: 我不愿意将代码以内源方式发布供其他人查看

en: Don't want to publish code for InnerSource
中文: 我不愿意将代码以内源方式发布供其他人查看

en: I do not know how to contribute to InnerSource
中文: 我不知道如何向内源做贡献

en: Don't know how to contribute to InnerSource
中文: 我不知道如何向内源做贡献

en: I am not sure what is suitable for InnerSource
中文: 我不确定什么(项目)适合内源（方式开发）

en: Don't know what's appropriate for InnerSource
中文: 我不确定什么(项目)适合内源（方式开发）

en: My immediate line manager would not be supportive of my contributions to InnerSource
中文: 我的直属经理不会支持我对内源项目的贡献

en: Lack of support from Line Manager
中文: 我的直属经理不会支持我对内源项目的贡献

en: There is too much to learn – new tools, new coding standards, etc.
中文: 有太多东西要学习–新工具，新编码标准等

en: Steep Learning Curve
中文: 有太多东西要学习–新工具，新编码标准等

en: Not knowing who consumes a shared system or code can make it difficult to add features without risking breaking a consumer
中文: 不知道谁在使用共享系统或代码，这可能很难保证添加功能时不会影响用户的使用

en: Breaking Changes affecting unknown consumers
中文: 重大变化可能会影响未知的消费者

en: The incentives for all this hard work are not appropriate
中文: 对这些辛勤工作使用了不恰当的激励

en: Incentives aren't appropriate
中文: 对这些辛勤工作使用了不恰当的激励

en: No appropriate incentive for me to contribute to InnerSource
中文: 没有适当的动机激励我为内源项目贡献力量

en: I do not have time to contribute to InnerSource
中文: 我没有时间为内源项目贡献力量

en: Don't have time to contribute to InnerSource
中文: 我没有时间为内源项目贡献力量

en: The projects are not interesting to me
中文: 这些项目对我来说并不有趣

en: Project are uninteresting
中文: 这些项目对我来说并不有趣

en: I feel that I’ll be judged by others if I make any mistakes
中文: 我觉得如果我有任何错误我会被别人评价

en: Being judged for mistakes
中文: 我觉得如果我有任何错误我会被别人评价

en: If you feel that you have concern(s) that is (are) not listed here, please feel free to write that down with the score you think it should have
中文: 如果您认为自己的担忧的问题不在此处列出，请写下您认为的问题并附上相应的分数

en: In addition, if you could think of ONE reason that would make you give InnerSource a try, what would that be?
中文: 另外，如果您想到一个可以让您尝试内源的原因，那会是什么？

en: Save to Dropbox
中文: 保存至Dropbox

en: Save to Local Storage
中文: 保存到本地存储

en: Download Data
中文: 下载数据

en: Save to SQLite DB
中文: 存储到SQLite DB

en: The InnerSource initiative is of significant importance to the top management who seek to foster a collaborative environment to ensure the long-term sustainability of software projects.
中文: 内源计划对于寻求营造协作环境以确保软件项目的长期可持续性的高层管理人员而言至关重要。

en: InnerSource seeks to apply the recipes of success from the Open-Source paradigm within a company and is heavily practiced by top companies around the world, e.g., Microsoft, Baidu, Tencent, SAP, Broadcom, and many more.
中文: 内源试图在公司内部应用开源范例的成功秘诀，并且被世界各地的顶尖公司（例如Microsoft，百度，腾讯，SAP，Broadcom等）广泛采用。

en: In a recent survey, 81% of the participants reported an increase in job satisfaction and 57% reported an increase in productivity in their own daily work after adopting the InnerSource style of working.
中文: 在最近的调查中，81％的参与者报告了 采用内源的工作方式后，工作满意度提高了，有57％的人表示自己的日常工作效率得到提高。

en: As a member of the management, your support for the InnerSource initiative would be hugely appreciated. 85% of the participants in a recent survey, confirmed that support from the management is critical for the success of the initiative.
中文: 作为管理层的一员，将非常感谢您对InnerSource计划的支持。 近期调查中，有85％的参与者确认管理层的支持对于该计划的成功至关重要。

en: We humbly request your understanding that although the initiative might face a few hiccups in the beginning, the long-term success will outweigh any short-term disruptions. Research suggests that management support in the initial tentative InnerSource phase is critical to long-term success.
中文: 我们谨谦虚地请您的理解和支持，尽管该计划一开始可能会遇到一些麻烦，但长期成功收益将超过任何短期阵痛。 研究表明，初期阶段的管理层支持对于内源的长期成功至关重要。

en: It might seem that if your employees are spending time fixing other people’s code the productivity of the team will suffer, but we assure you that won’t be the case.
中文: 如果您的员工花时间修复其他人的代码，团队的工作效率可能会受到影响，但我们向您保证，情况并非如此。

en: As mentioned earlier, the productivity of most employees seems to increase when they start working in InnerSource style.
中文: 如前所述，大多数员工在开始使用内源方式工作时，他们的工作效率似乎提高了。

en: You would be their guide in this journey, helping them along the way and also keeping them on-track to maintain a balance among the various responsibilities of the employees, and we are sure you’ll be pleasantly surprised when the process stabilizes and you can actually see an increase in the team productivity and innovation.
中文: 您将成为他们旅程的向导，帮助他们一路走来，并让他们保持员工各种职责之间的平衡，我们相信，当流程稳定下来时，您会惊喜地发现团队生产力和创新的提高。

en: We’d like to start by congratulating you for taking on/considering to take on the responsibility of maintaining one of the first InnerSource projects. The journey will be challenging, but in the longer-term, the benefits would likely be worth the effort.
中文: 首先，我们祝贺您承担/考虑承担维护第一批内源项目的责任。这段旅程将是具有挑战性的，但从长远来看，这些付出都是会有回报的。

en: You have a number of responsibilities in terms of getting the ancillary materials set up, advertising the project to potential contributors, reviewing contributions, and mentoring.
中文: 在设置辅导材料、向潜在贡献者宣传项目、审查贡献和指导方面，您负有许多责任。

en: We strongly suggest you check the “training materials” to better prepare yourself.
中文: 我们强烈建议您阅读“培训材料”，以便更好地做好准备。

en: We can promise you that it would be a story worth telling.
中文: 我们可以向您保证，这将是一个值得讲述的故事。

en: As a developer, you are the most valuable player in the InnerSource initiative. It is with your contributions across different projects that the initiative has any hope for success.
中文: 作为开发人员，您是内源 计划中最有价值的参与者。正是通过您在不同的项目中的贡献，该倡议才有成功的希望。

en: But we request you not to view it as simply another management mandated activity – this one is for your own benefit.
中文: 但是，我们要求您不要将其仅视为另一项由管理人员授权的活动-这是为了您自己的利益。

en: This initiative lets you work on projects and features YOU like and YOU care about, and, if you’re up for it, work with other people who like the same things you do.
中文: 通过该计划，您可以从事自己喜欢的项目和功能，并且如果愿意，可以与喜欢您所做的相同事情的其他人一起工作。

en: So, you might be wondering, how do I get started and what do I have to do?
中文: 因此，您可能想知道，我该如何开始以及接下来该怎么办？

en: Well, for starters, we’d encourage you to look at one of the pilot projects and see if you find any of them interesting.
中文: 好吧，对于初学者来说，我们建议您看一个试点项目，看看是否有一个有趣的项目。

en: If you do, please try to see what are the limitations and if you can find any bugs, and do report them.
中文: 如果这样做，请尝试查看有哪些（功能上的）限制，以及是否可以找到任何错误并进行报告。

en: If you are so inclined, and it’d be great if you are, please consider adding a feature that you think might be useful and/or fix one of the annoying bugs.
中文: 如果您愿意的话，那会很棒，请考虑添加您认为可能有用的功能和/或修复其中一个令人讨厌的错误。

en: Please enter your name and email*
中文: 请输入您的姓名和电子邮件*

en: Select an option!
中文: 选择一个选项！

en: Something went wrong
中文: 出问题了！

en: The File has been saved in Dropbox
中文: 文件已保存在Dropbox中

en: Results of InnerSource Obstacles Survey
中文: 内源障碍调查结果

en: Obstacles noted by the Managers
中文: 经理们识别出来的障碍

en: From Survey Questions
中文: 来自调查问题

en: Other Obstacles
中文: 其他障碍

en: One positive thing about InnerSource
中文: 内源能带来的一件积极的事情

en: Obstacles noted by the Repository Owners
中文: 代码维护人员识别出来的障碍

en: Obstacles noted by the Developers
中文: 开发者识别出来的障碍

en: Don't know what InnerSource is
中文: 我不知道内源是什么

en: I do not know how to attract other developers to my project
中文: 我不知道如何吸引其他开发人员加入我的项目

en: Timeline pressures and feature content commitments might not allow Developers to contribute to InnerSource projects
中文: 来自工期的压力和对功能开发的投入要求可能使开发人员无法为内源项目作出贡献

en: Based on your answers we have a few suggestions that you might find useful, mostly in terms of existing patterns which were proposed by field experts:
中文:
根据您的回答，我们有一些您可能会觉得有用的建议，这些建议主要参考了专业实践者们提出的现成模式：
。

en: InnerSource refers to the application of successful Open Source development practices within the bounds of a company. For concerns regarding InnerSource principles and benefits, please check out this link for getting started.
中文: 内源是指在公司范围内应用成功的开源开发实践。关于内源的原则和好处，请查看这个链接。

en: For concerns regarding resource allocation, we suggest starting the initiative as an experiment to figure out what works for your company. You might find the start-as-experiment pattern useful.
中文: 对于资源分配方面的顾虑，我们建议先用实验的方式推动内源举措，以找出最适合贵公司的实践模式。您可能会在start-as-experiment模式中找到对您有用的信息。

en: For concerns regarding quality of contributions from outsiders, you might consider implementing the 30-day Warranty pattern or the service-vs-library pattern.
中文: 对于来自外部团队贡献的质量问题，您可以考虑采取30天保修模式或服务vs库模式。

en: For concerns regarding InnerSource activity interfering with time and feature commitments, we don't have a proven solution, but setting up a gig-marketplace and the ideas proposed in the overcoming-project-management-time-pressures pattern might be useful.
中文: 对于内源项目打扰工期和功能开发的问题，我们还没有成熟的解决方案，但建立一个零工市场，以及克服项目管理时间压力模式中提出的想法可能会对您有所帮助。

en: For concerns regarding potential change in management structure disrupting the workflow, one possible solution could be setting up a review committee.
中文: 如果担心管理结构的潜在变化会扰乱工作流程的问题，一个可能的解决方案是建立一个审查委员会。

en: For concerns about having to handle all the work yourself and/or having to mentor every new participant, we strongly suggest assigning a Trusted Committer for your project.
中文: 如果担心必须亲自处理所有的工作或必须指导每个新的参与者，我们强烈建议为您的项目指定一个受信任的提交者。

en: For concerns regarding other people using your code without proper attribution, we suggest using an InnerSource license. This prepares the ground for handling any improper code reuse in future.
中文: 如果担心其他人在没有明确著作权的情况下使用您的代码，我们建议您使用

en:
For concerns about what might be suitable for InnerSource and how to attract other developers, we have a few suggestions: For attracting others, setting up a gig-marketplace or an InnerSource portal might be useful.
You can check the suitability of your project by checking the good-first-project pattern, and the cross-team project valuation pattern gives insights on measuring a project's value across different teams.
中文: 对于大家关心的如何用合适的方式引入内源以及如何吸引其他开发者加入的问题，我们有几点建议。为了吸引其他人，建立一个gig-marketplace或新手任务模式来检查一个项目的适用性，跨团队项目评估模式帮助您可以深入了解如何评估跨团队的项目价值。

en: InnerSource is more about changing the development mindset and less about individual tools. You can check out the InnerSource Learning Path to get started.
中文: 内源更多的是改变开发方法的思路，而不是部署个别工具。您可以查看内源 学习路径对内源进行更多了解。

en: We are working on designing the appropriate incentives. In the meantime, some the ideas listed in this pattern might be useful.
中文: 我们正在努力设计适当的激励措施。同时，这个模式中列出的一些想法或许有所帮助的。

en: With regards to concerns about getting support from your line manager, working on InnerSource projects on a contract basis, as suggested by the contracted-contributor pattern, might be useful.
中文: 对于如何从您的部门经理那里获得支持，按照合同贡献者模式的建议，以合同方式在内源项目中工作或许比较有效。

en: For problems regarding making breaking changes or adding new features, we suggest you to use semantic versioning.
中文: 关于如何进行突破性修改或添加新功能的问题，我们建议您使用语义化版本。

en: If you are not sure which project to contribute to or fear being judged by others, we suggest you look at a project you think would be useful to you and try to integrate the project/parts of the project in your workflow and follow the project discussions. It is a common practice in Open Source that a user gradually becomes more involved with a project (see this slide for reference).
中文: 如果不确定该为哪个项目做贡献，或者害怕被别人议论，我们建议您去找到一个您认为对您有用的项目，并尝试将这个项目/部分项目融入您的工作流程中，关注项目的讨论。在开源项目中，用户逐渐参与到一个项目中是一种常见的做法（参见这张幻灯片）。
